intro: Pimpinella mossamedensis, commonly known as the Mediterranean cowparsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained soils in sunny to partially shaded areas. The plant features slender stems and small, compound leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Pimpinella mossamedensis is often found in open woodlands and rocky habitats, contributing to local biodiversity.
